title: Hundreds of students displaced after burst pipe closes UMass Boston dorm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A burst sprinkler pipe flooded UMass Boston's East Residence Hall, displacing hundreds of students since Monday.
Approximately 50 rooms were affected by water damage across floors 2-10, prompting a no occupancy order due to unsafe conditions.
UMass Boston is providing temporary housing and shuttle services to displaced students while repairing water damage and electrical systems.

title: Seattle Public Library schools the Boston Public Library with book recommendations for Patriots fans
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Seattle Public Library recommended 35 books to Boston Public Library after Seahawks' Super Bowl win over the Patriots.
Recommendations include Michael Bennett's memoir and a political book on inflation, unrelated to deflation incidents.
Both libraries participate in Books Unbanned, promoting teens' freedom to read without censorship.

title: State auditor sues Beacon Hill to force compliance with audit
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio sues Massachusetts Legislature to enforce a voter-backed audit initiative passed 15 months ago.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell refuses to support the lawsuit, citing constitutional privileges and questioning DiZoglio's legal authority.
House Speaker Ronald Mariano and Senate President Karen Spilka are named defendants; GOP candidates support audit in election year context.

title: Man arrested in Seaport, charged with human trafficking
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Schineider Dave Macean, 23, was arrested for human trafficking and related charges in a Seaport sting operation.
The Boston Police and State Police conducted the undercover operation near Seaport Boulevard and Thompson Place.
Macean is scheduled for arraignment in South Boston District Court following his arrest.

title: As Boston residents report daytime coyote sightings, here’s how to stay safe
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Eastern coyotes are more visible in Boston during mating season from January to March, despite a stable population.
MassWildlife advises keeping pets indoors and removing food sources to prevent coyote encounters.
Residents should use aggressive hazing techniques to safely deter coyotes from their area.

title: Cam Newton reverses course with his comments on Drake Maye after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Cam Newton reversed his stance, praising Patriots QB Drake Maye after previously criticizing his performance during the 2025 NFL season.
Newton highlighted Maye's development despite the Patriots' Super Bowl LX loss, acknowledging his strides towards being an MVP candidate.
Drake Maye delivered 295 passing yards, two touchdowns, and two interceptions but struggled with turnovers in the Super Bowl loss.

title: James Hagens wins Beanpot MVP as Bruins prospects thrive in tournament
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens won the 2026 Beanpot MVP, contributing two assists in Boston College's 6-2 victory over Boston University.
Hagens, a 2025 Bruins first-round pick, now leads his team with 31 points over 24 games in his sophomore season.
Bruins prospects Andre Gasseau and Dean Letourneau also excelled, with Gasseau scoring twice and Letourneau leading BC with 16 goals.

title: Patriots CB Carlton Davis shares his pitch to free agents ahead of busy offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots cornerback Carlton Davis expressed optimism for attracting top talent in the upcoming offseason after Super Bowl loss.
New England anticipates making key additions with $42.7 million in cap space and potential contract restructuring.
Patriots' recent success and team culture positioned them as an attractive option for free agents, according to analysts.

title: Sticker shock for a dealerâ€™s quote to replace a starter
author: John Paul
bullets: Reader questioned a $1,200 dealership quote for a new starter on a 2014 Honda Accord EX.
AllData estimates a starter replacement cost of $925 based on parts and labor at $165 per hour.
Dealerships may charge 30-36% more than independent shops for similar auto repair work.

title: Where will Kristian Campbell play in the field for the Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kristian Campbell, 23, struggled defensively at second base and was sent to Triple-A Worcester in 2025.
Alex Cora announced Campbell will primarily play in the outfield for the Red Sox going forward.
Campbell's offensive potential remains strong despite outfield competition and his struggles at the plate in 2025.
